turns.content:
Given the following article, extract entities base on the SNOMED CT classification system

NRP Umbilical Venous Catheter (UVC) Placement
UVC Placement Video

Introduction
The umbilical vein is used for neonatal resuscitation for stabilization and resuscitation of the newborn. Through this venous line, volume and medications can be provided, such as intravenous epinephrine.

Equipment and Supplies
Single lumen catheter: either 3.5 Fr or 5 Fr
Single lumen catheter are used (instead of the standard double lumen) to decrease prep time
UVC tray
Normal saline flush
NoteNo time for sterile gown, gloves, or drapes during placement of emergency UVC
If UVC tray unavailable, consider creating an emergency kit for UVC placement:

Single lumen catheter
Antiseptic solution/betadine
Scalpel
Flush
Umbilical tape
Stopcock
Steps
Infant Preparation
1. Clean: clean the cord with betadine or other antiseptic

2. Tie: tie the cord with umbilical tape from tray

3. Cut : cut the cord with scalpel below cord clamp ~1-2cm from the skin

Catheter Preparation
4. Attach stopcock

5. Attach flush

6. Flush the catheter and stopcock

Insertion

7. Insert catheter in umbilical vein (at 12:00 when facing the head) to ~2-4cm until free flow of blood

8. Gently aspirate

The most important entities in this article are related to the procedure of umbilical venous catheter (UVC) placement, which includes the umbilical vein, catheter, and single lumen catheter. The article discusses the use of UVC in neonatal resuscitation and provides instructions on the steps to place a UVC in a newborn. Therefore, the entities related to neonatal resuscitation, such as neonatal resuscitation and newborn, are also important. Epinephrine is mentioned as a medication that can be provided through the umbilical vein, so it is also important. Antiseptic solution and betadine are mentioned as supplies for the procedure, while scalpel and umbilical tape are used in the process of placing the UVC, so they are relatively important. The remaining entities are either mentioned in passing or not directly related to the UVC placement procedure.
Generate a two sentence summary of the article

The article provides instructions on how to perform umbilical venous catheter (UVC) placement, which is used for neonatal resuscitation in newborns. The article details the equipment and supplies needed, the steps to perform the procedure, and alternatives if the UVC tray is not available.
Make the summary shorter and tailor it for a clinical practitioner audience

This article provides instructions for clinical practitioners on umbilical venous catheter (UVC) placement for neonatal resuscitation, including equipment and steps for the procedure, as well as alternatives when the UVC tray is unavailable.
Classify the procedure this article discusses using SNOMED CT
The procedure that this article discusses is "Umbilical venous catheterization (procedure)" with SNOMED CT code 443505007.
